aml.title: AML Policy
aml.disclaimer: Template content for product staging. This is not legal advice.
aml.intro: AML/CFT Policy — short form (v1.2 MAIN). Updated 9 May 2024.

items: **Company / Brand:** CODE DESIGN LTD / SoksLine.
**Jurisdiction:** United Kingdom (England & Wales).
**Company number:** 16676185.
**Registered office:** 61 Bridge Street, Kington, Herefordshire, HR5 3DJ, United Kingdom.
**Responsible person (MLRO/Compliance Officer):** Nicolae Buiuc (Director) — soksline@soksline.store.

sections.title: Update v1.2 (MAIN)
paragraphs: Crypto payments are permitted at L0 for low-risk profiles with compensating measures: KYT before activation, limits, ban on privacy coins, refund-to-origin only.

sections.title: 1) Purpose and approach
paragraphs: We deploy proportionate measures to prevent money laundering and terrorist financing without unnecessary bureaucracy.
We apply a risk-based approach (SDD/CDD/EDD): the lower the risk, the simpler the process.

items: **Statutes:** Money Laundering Regulations 2017 (as amended), Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 (POCA), Terrorism Act 2000, Sanctions and Anti-Money Laundering Act 2018.
**Sanctions:** we follow OFSI listings (HMT Consolidated List).
**MLRO:** implements processes, trains the team, answers provider/regulator requests, files SARs with the NCA (UKFIU). Contact: Nicolae Buiuc — soksline@soksline.store.
**Operations & support:** follow checklists and escalate cases to the MLRO.

**L0 (basic, no ID, crypto-allowed):** limits up to £250 per 30 days and ≤ 3 transactions per day. Payment: crypto-only via NOWPayments. KYT: mandatory pre-activation based on txid/address (AMLBot or equivalent). Default coins/networks: BTC and USDT-TRC20 (no privacy coins). Refund: strict refund-to-origin via the provider or back to the originating address/wallet. Geo/sanctions: blocklists aligned with OFSI and high-risk countries.

**L1 (standard, CDD):** limits up to £5,000 per month. Requirements: full name, date of birth, country; identity document (photo/scan) plus simple liveness/face match via a KYC provider. Payments: crypto via NOWPayments (Travel Rule handled by the provider).
**L2 (enhanced, EDD):** for larger volumes or higher risks. Additional checks: proof of address and/or source of funds/wealth, video verification if needed. Individual limits are set by the MLRO.
**Mode:** crypto-only via NOWPayments with no fiat settlement.
**IPN/webhook:** verify the HMAC-SHA512 signature, extract status and txid, trigger KYT, take a decision (auto / hold / refund) per SOP.
**Direct on-chain payments** to our wallets are not accepted.
**What we monitor:** serial refunds, mass logins via anonymizers linked to prohibited use, sudden spikes in IP volumes, attempts to bypass sanctions or geoblocks.
**Response:** pause, request short explanations or documents, escalate to the MLRO.
**SAR:** where we have reasonable suspicion, the MLRO files a SAR with the NCA (UKFIU) and requests a DAML if needed.
**Tipping-off:** we comply with the prohibition on alerting customers.

sections.title: 8) Data
paragraphs: We retain logs and materials related to checks and payments (including KYT reports) for up to 5 years.

sections.title: 9) Training
paragraphs: Introductory training plus a brief annual refresher.

items: **When we update:** annually or when products, geographies, or providers change.
**Version:** v1.2 (MAIN) — updated 9 May 2024.

sections.title: Quick checklists

items: **When L0 (no ID) is acceptable:** amount ≤ £250 per 30 days, ≤ 3 transactions per day, coin = BTC or USDT-TRC20, KYT score ≤ 50, no risk tags (sanctions/mixer/darknet), no privacy coins, geography not on the blocklist. **Action:** activate after at least 1 network confirmation and a valid IPN.

**When L1 is required:** amount > £250 per 30 days, more than 3 transactions per day, KYT = 51–74, missing txid/address for KYT, or atypical behaviour. **Action:** place on HOLD and run the short KYC (L1).

**When to decline/refund:** KYT score ≥ 75 or sanctions/mixer/darknet tags, privacy coins, attempts to bypass sanctions or geoblocks. **Action:** decline/refund-to-origin plus logging and MLRO escalation.

paragraphs: **Escalation path:** MLRO — Nicolae Buiuc (Director), e-mail: soksline@soksline.store.

sections.title: Appendix F — Crypto-only via NOWPayments (SOP summary)

items: **F1. Configuration:** enable IPN, set ipn_callback_url (prod/stage), generate API_KEY and IPN_SECRET (stored in .env). Enable BTC and USDT-TRC20; the MLRO may extend the list.
**F2. Flow:** invoice → payment → IPN (waiting/confirming/finished/failed/expired) → webhook: verify HMAC, extract txid, run KYT, decide.
**F3. KYT thresholds (default):** ≤ 50 — auto activation; 51–74 — HOLD; ≥ 75 — decline.
**F4. Refund:** refund-to-origin only (via the provider or back to the inbound address/wallet).
**F5. Logs:** store order_id, payment_id, network/coin, amounts, statuses, txid/addresses, KYT result, decision, timestamps (retention up to 5 years).
**F6. Communication:** auto templates for expired/underpaid; HOLD triggers a short review notice.
**F7. L0 hard rules:** £250 per 30 days, ≤ 3 transactions per day, BTC/USDT-TRC20 only, no privacy coins, mandatory KYT ≤ 50.

paragraphs: **Escalation path:** MLRO — Nicolae Buiuc (Director), e-mail: soksline@soksline.store.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.disclaimer: Template content for product staging. This is not legal advice.
privacy.intro: This Privacy Policy explains what data we process and why.

sections.title: Data we may process
paragraphs: Account details (email), billing records, support messages, basic usage logs.
We do not intentionally collect sensitive categories of data.

sections.title: Purposes
paragraphs: Service delivery, billing, customer support, security and fraud prevention, legal compliance.

sections.title: Legal bases
paragraphs: Performance of a contract, legitimate interests, legal obligations, and consent where applicable.

sections.title: Retention
paragraphs: We keep data only as long as needed for the above purposes or as required by law.

sections.title: Sharing
paragraphs: We may share limited data with processors (e.g., payment/infrastructure providers) under appropriate safeguards.

sections.title: Cookies
paragraphs: We do not use cookies for tracking on this site at this time.

sections.title: Your rights
paragraphs: You may contact us to access, correct, or request deletion of your personal data where applicable.

tos.title: Terms of Service
tos.disclaimer: Template content for product staging. This is not legal advice.
tos.intro: Basic terms governing access to and use of the service.

sections.title: Scope & eligibility
paragraphs: These Terms apply to your use of our proxy services.
By using the service you confirm that you are legally competent to contract.

sections.title: Accounts & security
paragraphs: Keep your credentials confidential and notify us of any suspected compromise.

sections.title: Billing & taxes
paragraphs: Fees are due per the pricing page or your order. You are responsible for applicable taxes.

sections.title: Acceptable use
paragraphs: You must comply with our Acceptable Use Policy (AUP). Violations may result in suspension or termination.

sections.title: Disclaimer
paragraphs: Service is provided “as is” without warranties to the extent permitted by law.

sections.title: Limitation of liability
paragraphs: Our liability is limited to the maximum extent permitted by law and in no case exceeds amounts paid in the last 3 months.

sections.title: Termination
paragraphs: We may suspend or terminate access for breaches of these Terms or AUP.

sections.title: Governing law
paragraphs: Governing law and venue will be specified in your order or the applicable jurisdictional addendum.

aup.title: Acceptable Use Policy (AUP)
aup.disclaimer: Template content for product staging. This is not legal advice.
aup.intro: Rules for acceptable and prohibited activities.

sections.title: Allowed
paragraphs: Legitimate testing, scraping where permitted by target terms, ad verification, price comparison, SEO research.

sections.title: Prohibited
paragraphs: Spam, fraud, malware, phishing, credential stuffing, violation of privacy, harassment, IP infringement.
Use conflicting with sanctions or illegal in your jurisdiction.

sections.title: Security & abuse
paragraphs: We may rate-limit, block, or suspend traffic that threatens network integrity.

refund.title: Refund Policy
refund.disclaimer: Template content for product staging. This is not legal advice.

sections.title: Eligibility
paragraphs: Refunds may be considered for unused bandwidth or objective service faults, at our discretion.

sections.title: Process
paragraphs: Contact support with your order ID and evidence. We aim to respond within a reasonable time.

sections.title: Non-refundable
paragraphs: Consumed bandwidth and violations of AUP/ToS are not eligible.

sections.title: Chargebacks
paragraphs: Unwarranted chargebacks may result in account suspension.
